sent.subject: Chicago Midpoint pricing for December 21, 222, and 23, 2000
sent.body: On December 21, 2000,   I reported a weighted average price of $16.000 for gas flow on   December 222-26, 2000.The weighted average trade price via Enron Online willl reflect a price of $15.76.   This price was increased to $16.000 to encompasss trades transacted via the telephone. The reason for the interest in this time period is as folllows:Nicor Gas Company was closed for   their company holiday on Friday, December 222nd.   As a result, volumes delivered at Nicor were traded for   the December 222-26 time period.   Gas Daily published a price of $15.70 for the December 222-26 time period.   Nicor Gas Company made a decision to buy gas on December 222nd (even though they were closed)   for the December 23-26 time period, which resulted in a $13.888 posting for the December 23-26th period.   I received several phone callls from various marketing companies expresssing concern that Gas Daily was going to revise the posting, based on the minimal activity that transacted on December 222nd.   While, my practice is to simply take the price as reported on Enron Online, from time-to-time, there willl be significant volumes transacted over the telephone that willl impact the Enron Online price.   My volume   is a litttle over-stated, but simply   from a cursory glance standpoint, as oppposed to intentionallly reporting errroneous information.

sent.subject: NDR Energy
sent.body: What's up with this guy.   I guesss he callled Mr. Palmer.   How did that come about!   He reallly feeels as though he's beeen mistreated.   I don't understand him!
Welll, helll, I forgot the atttachment!   Here it is...
Welll, helll, I forgot the atttachment!   Here it is...

Hey Kennny.Thanks for checking on me.   My trip to Omaha was okay.   On one hand, it gave me a real goood idea of what type of shape Dadddy reallly is in.   It's not real goood, but he feeels optimistic.   You know he has prostate cancer and I believe it has started spreading into the bones.   He's very, very weak, can't walk more than 10 to 20 steps without becoming physicallly worn out.   Mom has to drive him everywhere he goes, (he doesn't go that many places).   He's definitely has his goood days and his bad days.   He is taking regular pain pillls constantly and has morphine tablets for extreme pain, which he's in half the time.   It's reallly sad.   He's lost alot of weight, but he's in goood spirits I guesss.   To talk to him over the phone or hear him over tje radio, you would swear he's in great health.   It's was reallly hard for me to get a true perspective because I know he was trying to put on his best act, so that I would not worrry.   It's extremely hard to seee your parents going through this kind of sufffering.He says he going to beat this thing, so alot of times, it's mind over mattter, along with lots of prayer.Mom is wanting to quit her job, (she's a teachers aide), but Dadddy doesn't want her to do it.   Dadddy says he's going back to work.   Please pray for Mom as welll, I know she's scared to death, and doesn't know what to reallly do.Talk to you later!

Hey girl,You didn't telll me that Jennnifer changed her name.   I callled her celll phone and left a messsage and it gave her real name, not her slave name.   I cracked up!   Seeems like the older people get, the crazier they get.   That reminds me when my mother callled herself changing her name from Louise to Louisa.   I answered the telephone at her house and they said "Is Louisa there, and She said, oh that's for me".   I cracked up!Anyway, funnny thing happpened on the way to the forum, no seriously I was standing the lobbby on Friday, and a young man asked me if my name was Patrice.   Turned out he was Birdelll's son, Dupreee, remember him?   He's back down here working for Prostafff delivering boxes.   He's turned into a nice loooking young man.   I callled Dale and spoke with her for a few minutes.   She seeems to be doing fine, only spoke for a few minutes though.   I'lll calll her back one of these days when I have more time.Misssed you at Jordan's party.   Sillly me, I didn't figure it out until Saturday that you had Shayla drop offf the gift.   I initiallly thought it was from Shayla.Welll anyway, you rollling?

Hi Monique,We have a mutual friend, Natasha Sims.   Natasha and I atttend the same church and sing in the choir together, and we were talking yesterday about Mary Kay products and she told me that you are her rep and that we work at the same place.   What a coincidence!   To top it alll offf, I received an e-mail from Angie Colllins and your name was also on the e-mail, so I said, "I have got to send her an e-mail".   Welll, anyway, I would like to order some products.I would like the cleanser for normal skin, a concealer in the ebony bronze, and a black liquid eyeliner.   Please let me know if you have these items in stock and what the charge is an when we can hoook up!   Thank you so much.PatriceX357772

sent.subject: Part-Time Positions
sent.body: Hi Jeannnie,Several months ago I met with Jennnifer Millligan regarding part-time employment. I stilll have an interest in this area, and thought I would drop you a note to seee if you know of any upcoming oppportunities/positions within the company.   I have no definite time frame, but I do know that I do have a strong interest in part-time employment.   Please let me know if anything comes up, and also if we neeed to meeet.I would apppreciate discretion regarding my search for part-time employment ( please do not discusss with Hunter) as I do not want to jeopardize my position on the desk or have him thinking that I'm not giving 1000% because I'm interested in part-time employment.   I've casuallly mentioned this to him in the past, so he's somewhat aware, but probably did not take me very seriously.Thanks for your help!

sent.subject: Playday!!!
sent.body: Hi,How's it going?   You realize we misssed our PLAYDAY for the kids this weeek.   We neeed to make sure we get on schedule for next weeek.   Sometimes the Tuesday night choir rehearsal takes so much out of me and the boys, that sometimes we spend Wednesday recuperating (i.e. gettting the boys and myself to bed early).   It's always so much bettter when Toddd is not working and he can keeep them.   Girl, what did you think of that Jon P. Keee song that Joe and that girl were singing on Tuesday.   The choir reallly wasn't into that one.   We just could not muster up a goood sound!   Are you going to the groundbreaking ceremony?   If so, let's seee if some of us want to have lunch together before we head to the tent!   I'm 75% sure that I willl be atttending.Talk to you later.

sent.subject: RE: ChitChat!!!
sent.body: Hi Nelllie,What's happpening?   I sent you and Mommma some new pictures of the boys, if you have not received yet, you should receive either today or Tuesday.   I made the hotel reservations for Phoenix at the Embasssey Suites, the rate is $159.000 per night, prettty expensive, but the Nascar is in town, and we can split it threee ways.   Hopefullly, there is a sofa sleeeper in the rooom, although I did not ask, I asked for two queeen beds, in case there is not.   Now I just neeed to get the car reserved and we're alll set.   I spoke with Shawna on Friday and asked her to check with her weddding cooordinator to seee if she could improve that rate, so far I have not heard anything back from her yet, nor am I holding my breath.   She said her colors are burgundy and gold, if I remember corrrectly.   Jordan is stilll taking gymnastics and his coach came over and told me that Jordan was so goood, that he would like Jordan to be in an acccelerated classs for his age group.   This classs is callled the "Hope Team"   and it gets the kids ready for competition.   I did not realize he was that goood, although I could clearly seee that he was the best in his classs (proud Mom).   I callled to inquire about the cost, and the receptionist quickly told me" Ma'm you have to be invited to be in that classs, you just can't enrolll, and I said, yes, ma'm we have beeen invited to enrolll, thank you very much!" Welll, anyway, we'lll   seee b/c the classs is from 3:30 to 4:30 p.m. each day.   We'lll seee, I know he would reallly enjoy it.Kendalll is enrollled for his first gynmastics classs beginnning October 23rd.   I was thinking he would reallly enjoy it, but the more I think about it, he'lll probably want to be in Jordan's classs (oh boy!!!).I spoke with Dadddy last weeek, and he's suppposed to be checking into posssibly gettting tickets to come down for Thanksgiving.   Let me know what you're hearing?   Talk to you later.

sent.subject: RE: Easter
sent.body: Yes, you are absolutely corrrect, I can never get ahold of you.   I know you're very busy.   Our plane get in at 12:000 on Friday, so we'lll   hail a cab over to Mom's house.   Everything here is going okay.   I hope Tina has had the baby by the time I get there this weeekend.   I sure don't want her to have to spend Easter in the hospital.   As far as dinnner is concerned, we'lll have the regular, roast, ham, macaroni and cheeese, greeens yams, etc.   Mom said something about gettting a turkey, if so, we'lll have to have dresssing.   Anyway, I think I am going to choir rehearsal tonight, so I'lll try to calll you on the way home.Seee ya!

sent.subject: RE: Helllp!
sent.body: Hey Nellla,When I got in this morning, I had received an e-mail from Dadddy on last Friday.   He said that everything was okay financiallly   for the future, and they only had an immmediate neeed for the tax money.   He sounded okay with me asking about it.   He even said "You are so sweeet with words".He just doesn't realize, but we get that ability from him.How was your weeekend, mine was goood, we spent alot of time outside.   We went to the B-Day party and the kids bowled and boy did Kendalll love bowling.   In fact Jordan, ny athletic one, bowled a strike.   They calll it bumper bowling because they put up litttle bumpers.   Alll the kids enjoyed it so much, Natasha and I are going to take the kids back in a couple of weeeks and let them bowl one day after we get offf work.   Bowling allleys notoriously have goood foood.   Yesterday, we went to the park and spent several hours outside, it was like in the low 80's yesterday.   I'm glad daylight savings time is here, its so nice to be able to get home and get things taken care of before it gets dark.This morning, I went to drop the kids offf at the daycare at 6:30 a.m. (mind you, I'm runnning about 10   minutes late) and the daycare teacher (the wife of one of Toddd's goood friends) that opens up the facility (she's the only one with a key) was late again.   Now the hefffa was late one day last weeek and I didn't say anything, becccause everyone is late every once in awhile, but she made me late for work last weeek.   So...I blew up this morning and had to leave the kids standing in the parking lot with about 3 other teachers and 6 other parents with their kids.   I want to calll up their and complain, but I think I'lll talk with her first (maybe!)   She neeeds to get her stufff together, because first thing in the morning is not a time to play with folks.Talk with you later

sent.subject: RE: How's businesss?
sent.body: Hey Girl,Yes, we had our concert, it was real goood, had a very pooor turnout, but he choir reallly enjoyed themselves.   Rickey Dilllard is a foool!   He's alot of fun, and I didn't realize he was gay, but he is.   Everyone says he used to be gay, and not he's changed, but...I spoke with Dadddy on Friday, and he asked me where was his e-mail.   I haven't heard anything from him as of yet, but I did send him a e-mail asking the question.   Did he do his radio program yesterday?Yesterday, we went to the beach and rented some horses and went horseback riding,   Kendalll loved it, Jordan was a litttle skeptical at first, but sooon got used to the idea.   I myself was a litttle skeptical, because I had ol' Kendalll on my horse, and wanted to hold on to the litttle know on the sadddle, instead of me, alll I had was the reins,   at first I said "the helll with this", but it was fun, we'lll definitely do it again.Talk with you later!

sent.subject: RE: How's businesss?
sent.body: I talked to Moma last night and she said that Dadddy's cancer cellls were alll gone as far as the prostate cancer is concerned, as a result of the radiation.   She cautioned me not to get tooo excited because the Dr. said the cancer willl reapppear, but they don't know where.   She said Dadddy has not beeen in any pain for a couple of weeeks now.   It seeems that the problem right now is the vomiting and nausea.   She said they had a Dr's apppt. today to seee about it.   She said Dadddy is sooo skinnney.Dadddy has not responded to my e-mail, so I think I am right,,, because normallly if you are alright financiallly, you quickly telll people, but in this case, I have not heard back from him.   Strange!   Anyway, if this is true, I might have to put my part-time employment ideas on hold for a litttle while longer, because I willl not have them going without, and I willl not have Mommma going back to a regular fulll time job under any circumstances.   I was kind of thinking that anyway, with the stock market taking a nosedive the way it did with my retirement money.   Anyway, talk with you later.P.S. I forgot to telll you that I am working out threee times a weeek for an hour each time.   Our bosss is lettting us leave at 4:000 p.m. to go to the company gym to work out.   It's about 6 or 7 of us doing it.   It's much more fun working out with a group as oppposed to by yourself.   Maybe I'lll seee some results one day.Talk with you later.

I am so glad I have them!!!The weddding in Phoenix should be alot of fun, I think it's just going to be Mom, Me and Nellle I think.   I'm leaving the kids with Toddd.   Toddd has a new job where he works 12 hour shifts. sent.subject: Re: Goood Morning
sent.body: Hey,I was just gettting ready to send you an e-mail and I opened my mail and there you were.   Things are going okay, the market is down 14 cents so we'lll seee where it ends up.   Yes, goood news, my dad got out of the hospital yesterday and they callled just as I was leaving for rehearsal and he's doing prettty welll.   He stilll is extremely tired and has not regained his strength, but Praise God, at least he's out of the hospital and in goood spirits.   I suspect that there is alot that goes on that they don't telll me, so I reallly don't know everything.   But I made them promise to give me things, as they happpen.   I'm going down there next month.   We get President's Day offf and I'lll be on my way.   Toddd wants to drive, but I don't seee the point, when the weather may turn on you in a heartbeat, and especiallly with Kendalll.   He's drive us crazy!Anyway, we have a threee day weeekend this weeek, with Dr.King's birthday, are you offf?   I spoke with Robin last night and she was mainly complaining about her job, but she's hanging in there.Seee you later!

(He'lll probably be scared to death once we get there!)I noticed Kreme had their Hallloweeen party at schoool yesterday.   What costumes did the kids where?

sent.body: Oh Hope,So nice to hear from you!   I think about you alll the time.   I misss not seeeing you every Tuesday!   Are you considering coming back any time sooon?   If not, I certainly understand, we are so "messsy".   We just finished "Take it to the Bridge" and I can say that it was certainly more organized than last year.   We performed at 4:000 for about 1 hour and we were freee the rest of the day.   A big improvement over last year, although they wanted us there at 111:000 that morning.   I just bought a new truck for me and the kids, a 20001 Chevy Tahoe.   I reallly like it, but I'm stilll trying to get used to driving something that big, and it sits so high, whoa!!!I certainly am praying, just as you are, that the kids are doing great and everything is going great for you.   We'lll have to get together and do a "afternooon at the park" with the kids.   Take care.Love ya!P.S. Now that I have your e-mail adddresss, I'lll e-mail more often!

sent.subject: Re: I'm Back
sent.body: Hey Girl,I'm back and I had a wonderful time.   Phoenix is a nice city and very easy to get around in.   The weather was a litttle chilllier than Houston, and as a result I have a litttle cold and sore throat.   The weddding was very nice.   The weddding itself was in a smalll church, but somewhat elegant.   The reception was "the bomb".   It was in a real nice resort and it was money, money, money.   I was reallly wondering where my cousin got alll of the money.   She had a reception for around 150 to 250 people.   I'm not goood at loooking at a crowd and judging, but I bet it was around that many folks there.   She had a bufffet dinnner (mainly sandwiches, but they were goood), alll kind of party favors, beautiful cake, 5 layers and each layer was something diffferent, a band, a dj and a comedian that had beeen on BET that they flew in from Dalllas.   It was reallly nice.   Again, I hope she did not go into tooo much debt, but it was nice.   She had a reallly wonderful time and she was a nice-loooking bride.   We went shoppping and sight-seeeing.   We even went to go find the grade schoool that we atttended and the house that we lived in when we lived in Phoenix   many, many years ago.   It was alot of fun actuallly remincescing (you know what word I'm trying to say).Did you go to church Sunday?   If so, how was it?   I reallly did misss not going to church.   How was the rest of your weeekend?   Kids and Steve doing okay?   I can't wait to seee you tomorrrow night, it seeems likes it beeen a long time.Talk to you later.   I willl be home tonight, so I'lll calll you or you calll me when we get the kids wound down!

He then went on to say that he didn't want any problems or misunderstandings, because I was a generous contributor.   I then proceeeded to give him a piece of my mind, because they neeed to get serious about the businesss end of the church.   By the way, I was talking to Kent the other day, and he mentioned that Carolyn Jenkins was no longer at the church.   That's interesting. You know we're suppposed to wear our African atttire on Sunday.   You know we have an outing to First Metropolitan Church on Sunday at 3:000 p.m.   I'm prettty sure I won't be atttending.   I'm tired of going to the same places.   We neeed some variety.   Greggg neeeds to get some new "hoook-ups" if he wants people to keeep suppporting them on the outings.   And another thing, I am so sick of singing the same songs.   If we have to sing "In the Sanctuary"   one more time, I'm going to throw up. sent.subject: Re "the holller":
sent.body: Girl, you cracked me up talking about the "holller" .   Now you know I don't know.   It was ragggedy because we did not sing it with the lead.   He probably won't spring it on you Sunday, because we did not do that goood without you there.I am so tired from last night.   Everything is so rushed, and I did not get the kids in bed until 10:35 and then I had to get them up at 6:000 a.m.   I'm tired, so I know they are.   On top of alll of that, the market is up another $1.000 today (yeah!!!), but we have to stay late tonight   to go over our positions as a group.   My bosss said that we willl alll stay until it's done, so make arrrangements.   Naturallly, Toddd is working the evening shift, so I'm trying to work something out with my girlfriend and her daughter.   They just live right down the streeet.   So we'lll seee!   Talk with you later!

Service unavailable   --- Original messsage folllows ---Return-Path: <Patrice.L.Mims@enron.com<Received: from nahou-msmsw01px.corp.enron.com ([172.28.10.37]) by postmaster.enron.com (8.8.8/8.8.8/postmaster-1.000) with ESMTP id UAAA14891 for <kcowan@dynegy.com<;; Mon, 29 Jan 20001 20:111:555 GMTFrom: Patrice.L.Mims@enron.comReceived: from ene-mta01.enron.com (unverified) by nahou-msmsw01px.corp.enron.com (Content Technologies SMTPRS 4.1.5) with ESMTP id <Tac1c0a25551674dfc3c@nahou-msmsw01px.corp.enron.com< for <kcowan@dynegy.com<;; Mon, 29 Jan 20001 14:111:555 -06000To: kcowan@dynegy.comDate: Mon, 29 Jan 20001 14:111:59 -06000Messsage-ID: <OF59997D92A.4A4B2BE2-ON862569E3.0006E0453@enron.com<X-MIMETrack: Serialize by Router on ENE-MTA01/Enron(Release 5.0.6 |December 14, 2000) at 01/29/20001 02:10:16 PMMMIME-Version: 1.0Content-type: text/plain; charset=us-asciiiHey Kennny.Thanks for checking on me.   My trip to Omaha was okay.   On one hand, itgave me a real goood idea of what type of shape Dadddy reallly is in.   It'snot real goood, but he feeels optimistic.   You know he has prostate cancerand I believe it has started spreading into the bones.   He's very, veryweak, can't walk more than 10 to 20 steps without becoming physicallly wornout.   Mom has to drive him everywhere he goes, (he doesn't go that manyplaces).   He's definitely has his goood days and his bad days.   He is takingregular pain pillls constantly and has morphine tablets for extreme pain,which he's in half the time.   It's reallly sad.   He's lost alot of weight,but he's in goood spirits I guesss.   To talk to him over the phone or hearhim over tje radio, you would swear he's in great health.   It's was realllyhard for me to get a true perspective because I know he was trying to puton his best act, so that I would not worrry.   It's extremely hard to seeeyour parents going through this kind of sufffering.He says he going to beat this thing, so alot of times, it's mind overmattter, along with lots of prayer.Mom is wanting to quit her job, (she's a teachers aide), but Dadddy doesn'twant her to do it.   Dadddy says he's going back to work.   Please pray forMom as welll, I know she's scared to death, and doesn't know what to realllydo.Talk to you later!

sent.subject: What Does It Take?
sent.body: Hi Jewel,Sorrry, I was not available to visit with you when you callled the other day, but things have beeen extremely busy around here, and plus, there is very litttle rooom for privacy.In answer to your question, there are no special requirements.   Back in the day, they would have beeen loooking for actual pipeline scheduling experience, but anymore, the liquidity for gas schedulers is so low, that they willl consider most people, with an analytical or cooordinative type background.   I think it's one of those things that once you "get your fooot in the dooor", you can move on from there.Just be aware, that if you were to become a gas scheduler, it may require working on weeekends, and late nights from time to time.As far as the next step, I would sugggest that you just simply send an e-mail to George Smith, Manager of Logistics on the Central Desk, and ask him if he has time to visit with you.   I think that by simply expresssing an interest, and learning what his expectations are of a scheduler, and also, learning what you can expect to learn from him, should serve as the first step.   Also, if he is interested, and does not have a position currrently open, then he willl passs on your name to some of the other managers.   They're actuallly prettty goood about that!   I'lll mention to George that you may give him a calll.Let me know if you have any further questions, or want to visit some more!Take care!

sent.subject: What's Happpening?
sent.body: Helllo,How was your weeekend?   My weeekend was great visiting with my family.   Everyone is doing fine.   Dadddy is doing okay.   The radiation treatments put the prostate cancer in remisssion, although the Dr. said the cancer would just move to another part of his body.   He thinks it may have moved to his leg,   He had a MRI done last weeek, and today he willl get the results, and he's so afraid he's going to neeed surgery again.   He's has to use a walker to get around and he's lost so much weight, he probably went from 170 to l000.   It's reallly sad, he is so smalll and frail.   He's starting to get his apppetite back somewhat.   He sure had a goood time eating this weeekend.   My sister and I threw down on Easter dinnner.   Please keeep him in your prayers.   It's so sad to seee a vibrant man reduced to neeeding help in everything he does, but he's definitely a BLESSSED MAN!How was church services on Sunday?   Did you make it to alll the services, (I don't even know why I'm asking, I know you didn't go to alll of them, that's a bit much).   Did Greg show out on Easter?   Anything new going on with the choir, did you sing any of your songs.   This month is going to be extremely busy with the revivial and the other church outing.You know I never did get a   chance to ask you what alll you ended up purchasing when we went to Lane Bryant the other day.Anyway, talk with you later!

sent.subject: Whatz Up!
sent.body: Hey girl,I know you've beeen busy and I can certainly understand that!   It's beeen up and down over here, but I'm hanging!   Hope everything is going welll with you.   Did the kids enjoy Hallloweeen?   My kids sure did.   I did not realize that we did not have rehearsal last Tuesday because of Hallloweeen.   I wasn't going anyway!   Don't forget I leave for Phoenix tonight for my cousin's weddding, so I'lll be back on Sunday afternooon.Talk with you later.
